=== EMAIL TO JAG 8 Oct 2010 ===
Hi Jag,

I have a few more questions regarding the staging environment:

1. Staging load-balancer

http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com is currently live to the general internet.

* ActionPoint 1. Although this is beyond my remit, I would advise retricting access in some way - either at an apache level, or at the akamai level, or at an o/s or hardware firewall level.


2. Staging servers: stage03/04

2.1. Apache

Currently, stage03/04's Apaches do NOT use NameVirtualHost's.

I recommend that we SHOULD use NameVirtualHost's. If Apache is set up differently to web01/04 then it introduces a whole class of error that cannot be caught by testing in the staging environment.

* ActionPoint 2. Can stage03/04 have Apache set up to use NameVirtualHost's please? We currently only need one host set up: vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com.

2. Rsync

Currently, stage03 is NOT synced with stage04.

* ActionPoint 3. Can stage03 be periodically synced with stage04 (in the same way as web01 is synced with web02,3,4) please?



Can I kindly request that these issues be addressed as urgently as is possible?

I ask, because the absence of the staging environment is preventing us from launching any new functionality (of which there is now a sizable backlog). This does not impact Kitsite, per se, but is likely to cause some issues very soon for locog staff (for example, I believe there is an important splash page required for next Friday, which we cannot promote without the staging environment in place).

Thanks, in advance,

Kieran

 http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com

Access

 username: webcontent

Apache

Have requested that they DO use NameVirtualHost's (as per email, attached).
 
Rsync
-----

Base-hrefs
==========
These are now written dynamically - i.e. in php, by checking the value of $_SERVER["SERVER_NAME"]. This means that we DON'T have to amend the base-hrefs when copying between the servers.

NB This is currently only true for templates that use <content:base/>

Other ones (e.g. re. registration will need to be amended manually).

comments.value:
Hi Jamie
 
As you know, you carried out some work allowing us to turn on/off time-lapse function on the webcams, which is great feature for us to be able to use.
 
However we would like to find a permanent solution allowing us to sort out issues with the current time-lapse on the webcams. which possibly  means we stop using Stamen to produce the time-lapse for the webcams  and start using Site-Eye as they hold all the images and there would be one less supplier in the chain. But before Site-Eye send us a quote for the work, they need have speak with yourself to clarify the technical details of what would be entailed in integrating the new time-lapse feature they produce into the page/CMS. 
 
I am happy to act as intermediary but I think a lot of detail will be lost in translation. If it’s OK with you I’ll pass on your details to Site-Eye.
 
Uzma. 
 
Uzma Khan
Marketing Assistant 
Communications 
Direct line: 020 3023 6927

Hi Gareth

Answers below..

On 2 Dec 2010, at 14:03, Gareth Evans-McClave wrote:

Hi Jamie
 
We are looking at a number of options to provide this functionality.
 
Could you help by answering the questions below please?
 
	• Is the current app hosted on your site, or do you link to the 3rd parties servers?

It's on a 3rd party server (*) we just load a Javascript file into the webcam pages which in turn loads the Flash file and rewrites the HTML / the DIV (displayImageWrapper) containing the webcam image.
http://map.london2012.com/webcams/webcam-swap.js

You can see an example here
http://www.london2012.com/webcams/velodrome.php

(*) map.london2012.com is within the LOCOG/ODA infrastruture but not managed by us.

• If its on your site, have they provided you with a program to take on the images, or do they provide the whole sequence as a flash movie or similar?

The images are pulled direct from the live site on a periodic basis and stored on map.london2102.com (this is in effect a 3rd party server / application, see above)

The Flash file / overlay then retrieves the relevant images depending on the time/date settings of the sliders.

The Flash file / overlay is real time, by that I mean it's not a pre-generated timelaspe movie of say the Velodrome over the summer or the past week.

The overlay also allow a time period per day to also be selected (see attached) - which filters the time lapse to only show that hour per day when the movie is played back.



	• Do you have any restrictions on the type of content you can serve. I.e. could we provide the app as a java applet, silverlight, flash etc?

The London 2012 web guidelines I think exclude Java applets and Silverlight.

Flash is fine as long as we degrade gracefully, which in this case would mean a user would just see the webcam as an image.

	• If we hosted the app on our servers and you presented it in an <iframe> on your page, would that be ok?

If this was /just to provide the overlay/ I think this would be acceptable.

But it wouldn't be acceptable for the underlying static webcam image, firstly I think ODA/LOCOG would like all images to be served from their domain so that they get indexed in Google Image search with the correct domain, secondly from a usability perspective we try to avoid IFRAMES for any key content and finally lastly we need a copy of the latest image in the CMS / tied to a webcam page so we can pull a thumbnail of it into other pages such as the Venue pages based on related tags.

 I think that is all I can think of for now. Any details on how the current system works would help.

In terms of the functionality and how the Flash movie is loaded into the page as an overlay, have a look at this page.
http://www.london2012.com/webcams/velodrome.php

In terms of the images themselves we just retrieve a copy of the webcam from yourselves every 15 mins, hold it for 15mins (in case of a accident etc.) and then publish it out to the live site (sample url below). We don't keep an historical copies of the images on the live server.
http://www.london2012.com/transform/1965113/m700x/velodrome.jpg

Hopefully that answers a few questions, let us know if you need any more info..

Jamie

We have a problem in that we have to switch off our current video provider, Big Button, by the end of October.

This means expediting the process of integrating the  new Twofour player into the site. I have  asked them to send through their full API doc, but this seems not yet to have been completed - though they say it doesn't vary much from the earlier doc which Jamie was sent.

However, would appreciate your thoughts on what we need to do to get the video player integrated by end October....

Morag, could you get them to send through the latest available version of the documentation to me at danny@kitsite.com? In Jamie's absence, you might have to baby-step us through exactly what needs to be done, but I see no reason why we can't start work on this as early as next week. Maybe we should discuss this by phone. I will call you in a few minutes.
Yes, I will do

From Sam Graber at twofour:

We can confirm that before the 29th October we will be delivering a “vanilla” flash embed player with standard controls (play, pause, scrub bar, volume controls) and our standard MEDIAFREEDOM package which allows the maintenance of content and upload of new content.  We can also incorporate pre and post roll at this stage if you happy to have the same pre and post roll videos for every clip.
 
·         We will deliver to kitsite a embed code for the player, .swf object and javascript by the end of this week (WE 15/10/10)

·         Next week we will work with them to integrate these into the CMS, and provide a version of the MF admin system. (WE22/10/10)


For each of the videos we have and also any that you need to send through to us we will require a title, description, a thumbnail if you have it and any associated Tags you would like assigned to the video.  We can ingest all this information in one go to save having to add it manually after the system has gone live.   If you could send through this information in a spreadsheet that will be fine.
 
The final delivery for all other functionality is currently being planned in for the end of November.  Once designs are signed off we shall commence the build of your player.  We need to allow 3 weeks for this build of these, and then a week for testing so we will require sign off on the visual by the end of this week to ensure they will be ready for the end of November.

comments.value:
We need to modify our website sign up page to allow us to collect data from businesses who wish to be informed about travel during the Games.

This will be a sign-up link from the new Travel Advice to Businesses web pages on London 2012 to the existing sign up form on London 2012.

Our objective is to allow customers/businesses to register their details with London 2012 such that the Travel Advice to Business team will be able to periodically send important information to this user group.

We want to adapt the existing sign up form so that there is only one place to sign up on London 2012 and believe the best thing to do is to adapt the existing Business sign up element.

We are assuming that the database that currently exists resulting from business sign would be archived or separated off in some way, allowing the entire dataset to be started from scratch.

Business sign-up update requirements:

1.	All current fields should remain with the exception of the free text entry field titled “Area of Interest” which should be removed.
2.	The industry category field should be updated to include the below list of organisation industry categories (replace existing list). NB these are too long - will provide final values later! 
i.	Agriculture, forestry and fishing
ii.	Mining and quarrying
iii.	Manufacturing
iv.	Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
v.	Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities
vi.	Construction
vii.	Wholesale and retail trade; repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
viii.	Transportation and storage
ix.	Accommodation and food service activities
x.	Information and communication
xi.	Financial and insurance activities
xii.	Real estate activities
xiii.	Professional, scientific and technical activities
xiv.	Administrative and support service activities
xv.	Public administration and defence; compulsory social security
xvi.	Education
xvii.	Human health and social work activities
xviii.	Arts, entertainment and recreation
xix.	Other service activities
xx.	Other

3.	The size of business category should be updated to include the attached list.
i.	0-9
ii.	10-19
iii.	20-99
iv.	100-499
v.	500-999
vi.	1000-2499
vii.	2500 +

Ideally the text “size of organisation” should be replaced with “Number of employees based at your organisation's current location”
                                                                        
4. New field addition:
a.	How did you hear about this programme?
Options are:
i.	Press advertising
ii.	Online advertising
iii.	Word of mouth
iv.	Through a member organisation
v.	Meeting with a London 2012 advisor
vi.	London 2012 website
vii.	Email
viii.	Direct mail

In terms of presentation, we need to make some tweaks to this form so that the Business sign-up bit is more obvious. At the moment it’s not that intuitive – you have to click open the special part of the form. We would want to expose the whole form and to have an anchor link to it from the top of the page to make it clearer.

The date for this as always is too soon. They would ideally like it to go live with the Travel Advice to Businesses content on 24 November. Please can you give a realistic view of how long this will take and when it could realistically be slotted into the schedule?

Hi Morag,

There is a question regarding what to do about the overlap between the old category and organisation size fields.

For new users there isn't an issue, but for legacy users we need to decide what to do with their data, even if we do some mapping/clean-up, if we have a old user with an 'organisation size' set to <50 what is appropriate size in the new list? i.0-9 ii.10-19 iii. 20-99 (...or phone a friend)

We could just drop all the current values and then if a legacy user comes back later, the field will be blank and they will have to select new values.

The danger of keeping both an old and new set of values (the stored values not just the values on the pulldown) is that there may be places in the site and particularly in the CMS where we create a drop down based on the /values/ that have been entered. This will mean we may get a mix of old and new options.

The alternative is to create a new field for each ie newOrgSize and newCategory, but equally that could get equally confusing.

I think the best/easiest would be to remove the old values for those fields, with a slightly more intelligent approach of removing them only if a corresponding new value doesn't exists (obv. doing data clean up with have a cost).

I terms of adding the values / sorting out the form it's probably a couple of days work to code, test and deploy. 

Jamie

Thanks, Jamie.

I agree that with legacy users the best route is to drop all the current values altogether – we almost certainly won’t want to use them again.

Thanks for the cost/time estimate. In terms of workload though, is this feasible by 24 Nov? And what kind of testing do you think this would need to go through?

> is this feasible by 24 Nov?

I think it probably is, need to double check with Kieran as he is more than likely going to be involved in some of this.

> what kind of testing do you think this would need to go through

The $100 question ;-)

We'll take a clone of the site and test it on our dev server / environment before putting anything live.

But this actually is a *prime* candidate for proper testing / running though a staging server which in all respects is the same as web01-06; basically what we been pushing for and ITS (I think) have been asking for.

Now the question is :

a) will BT have the staging sever setup (per Kierna's email) by 17th December (ie. one week prior to launch so e have time to test it on staging)
b) will getting a staging sever setup (per Kierna's email) by 17th December eat up all our available time / resources (there actually isn't much we need to actually do, but I cannot imagine it's going to go live without us being on a least a few conference calls/answering a few e-mails)
Reset to urgent.
CAB request raised.
Great – is there a call this pm? Do I need to be on it?
Final spec for this coming through shortly

Morag, to answer your question about the CAB request, I don't know if somebody needs to be on the call this afternoon. I haven't had a response to my email yet, or at least I have had the following automated response from ITLOCOGCAB@london2012.com: 

"Please note that all changes should be raised electronically via https://london2012.service-now.com/ - if you enquiry is regarding any other Change enquiry we will process it as business as usual."

I also sent the request to Service.change2012.management@bt.com

I was rather hoping that if we needed to do anything else, I would hear about it.

Sigh – you can’t access Service Now, and neither can we!

I am investigating....

Following on from our discussion yesterday, this is the definitive spec for requirements for the amds to the sign-up process ready for the 24 November launch of the campaign (now known as 'Keep on running')

User journey:
We want to have a link in the left hand nav of the Travel Advice to Business section which will take users straight to the sign up form, but recognising the origin of the user in the Business section. We want this to work in the same way that the 'Business e-alerts' link works currently in the general Business Network section i.e. it takes you to a particular view of the sign-up page with the Business elements mandatory e.g. https://www.london2012.com/settings/register.php?user%5Bemail%5D=morag.reavley%40london2012.com&reason=businessProfile
The problem is the gap between the elements you have to fill in at the top of the page and then the fact that the rest of the Business sign-up elements are much further down the page - is there anything you can do to make these more tightly connected e.g. an anchor link?
At the top of the  sign-up page I would like to add some general intro text above the yellow header bar 'Please register using the form below' - we will provide this copy asap but if you could put some holding text in for now that would be great.

Business sign-up form elements:
Company name - as is
Job title - as is
Address line 1 - as is
Address line 2 - as is
Address line 3 - as is
Address line 4 - as is
Town - as is
County - as is
Post code - as is
Country - as is but default to United Kingdom if possible
Region - as is
Telephone number - as is 
Business sector - delete the current field values and replace with:
Agriculture, forestry and fishing
Mining and quarrying
Manufacturing
Utility supply
Water supply
Construction
Wholesale and retail
Transportation and storage
Accommodation and food services 
Information and communication
Financial and insurance
Real estate
Professional and scientific, technical
Administrative and support
Public administration and defence
Education
Health and social work 
Arts and entertainment 
Other services
Other 

Area of interest - remove field from the website form but do not delete from back end

Size of organisation - change to 'Number of employees/contractors' - replace dropdown with these values:
0-9
10-19
20-99
100-499
500-999
1000-2499
2500+

Annual turnover - remove this field from form but do not delete from backend

Business preferences - two new checkboxes (checking one is mandatory)
Sign up for Travel Advice to Business updates 
Sign up for general business updates

How did you hear about the Travel Advice to Business programme? - new field (dropdown, non-mandatory)
Press advertising
Online advertising
Word of mouth
Through a member organisation
Meeting with a London 2012 advisor
London 2012 website
Email
Direct mail
Other


Other requests:
New title for the Business sign-up section: “Your business profile (if you wish to receive Travel Advice to Business updates or general business information)
Under the general sign-up preferences we have a checkbox showing for 'Transport' - can this be removed from the form (not deleted from the database though) as this may confuse people in terms of which box to check
Is it possible to indicate somewhere on the form (perhaps in the yellow header bar where it says "Please register using the form below.") that people signing up for business updates should leave their business e-mails i.e. “If you are signing up for business updates, please use your e-mail address."

As mentioned, this is pretty critical as we have a campaign launching around this on 24 Nov in which the main call to action will be to 'sign up for business travel information'. So I would like to get it live a couple of days ealier than that if at all possible to make sure there are no bugs - if we could get it live on the Monday that would be fabulous.

Happy to answer questions - it is quite complicated! Thanks very much!

Morag

We have received confirmation from the Change Advisory Board that this change does not require pre-approval, but the BT service desk should be notified after deployment. Notification marked as "required".

Yay – good work, thanks!

Please can you let me know if you have any questions / concerns re: the instructions below for the business sign-up?

Copy to go at the top of the form, introducing the sign-up process: 

If you would like to keep up-to-date with all the latest information from London 2012, sign up to hear from us. Please register using the form below, selecting the mailing lists you wish to subscribe to. Individuals representing a business can sign up for updates on business opportunities and/or updates on travel advice for organisations during the Games, by completing the first section and the business profile section at the end of the form.

Small change to the copy to go at the top of the form, introducing the sign-up process:

Keep up-to-date with all the latest information from London 2012! Register using the form below, selecting the mailing lists you wish to subscribe to. 

If you represent a business, you can sign up for updates on business opportunities and/or updates on travel advice aimed at helping organisations and businesses plan for the Games. Complete the first section and the business profile section at the end of the form.

We would like to proceed by adding the requested tags to the TAB website (this has been cleared by Huw and doesn’t need to go through CAB). Are you able to do this?

Hi there,

I need to delete this photo from the site but am finding it very difficult to track it down...

http://www.london2012.com/photos/2009/02/partner-and-supporter-activity-61724.php


1.       Can you delete the photo?

2.       Is there an easy way of finding photos in CMS? Searching by title doesn't always do the trick.

Thanks,
Kathryn

Assuming that you want to delete the page as well, you do the following:
- In the CMS, select Files > Photo pages: http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/data/Photo%20pages
- type "partner and supporter activity" into the search box top right (make sure that "Photo pages only" is checked)
- the page you are looking for should appear at the top of your search results
- Select "Expire or delete" from the toolbar.

If you are still having problems, please do let me know.

Thanks, that worked – but I guess if, as in this case, there are multiple images with the same name, we just have to go through them to find the one we’re looking for?

Thanks,
Kathryn

Oops! Kathryn, I somehow overlooked your question. Sorry for the slow response, but you are partly correct. If multiple images have the same name, you will have go through each of them, however in many cases images have an identifying number as part of the name, as in http://www.london2012.com/photos/2009/02/partner-and-supporter-activity-61724.php. This should make it easier to identify the correct one.

Was chasing this one w/ Kieran (.5 days). Fix has deployed so Lars can do the actual work part.
0.1 Lars

The previous "forgetting" bug has now been fixed but another problem has arisen as in
can we put a css margin on every image in #PageContent. If we do this using the main
css we will most definitely break things. Alternatively a solution using an if (path) {} to add the
css will create a lot of messy code. So the best solution i could come up with was using 
the newly created content:cdata field to sort this.

If anyone objects ( which i would understand ) or has a better of doing this then let me know!

Code in template:

<!-- Custom css field which allows you to add custom css to a particular
       page using the cms editor. For safety this field is set to style="display:none"
       and needs to manually be unhidden to be edited -->

      <content:cdata id="customCss" style="display:none;" />

<!-- end -->

Field content for example:
 <style type="text/css">#PageContent img { margin-right: 10px;}</style>

Sorted and looking good! ( to me )

So please have a look at: 
http://dev.kitsite.com/kit/preview/about-us/the-people-delivering-the-games/the-london-organising-committee/locog-board.php

Just wanted to flag with you the closing of the GM application process.

The plan is to close public applications at midnight on 27 October. We will need to remove the link to the application form from the website - I should be able to do this myself as it's just editing the include. The link to the portal (Games Maker zone) remains. 

We will keep the specialist form open (though we will remove some codes/identifiers) until 12 November, when we will close that (but keep it available for reactiviation if we need to later). The easiest thing will probably be just to move it to a different place so the URL doesn't work. Again, I can almost certainly do this myself.
Marked as high. Assigned to Jamie for now.
